intro: Rotheca violacea, commonly known as violetleaf rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with violet or purple hues. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. Rotheca violacea is a member of the Verbenaceae family, which includes several other ornamental and medicinal plants. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
